intro: Fagara odorata, commonly known as the fragrant fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a smooth, spiny capsule that contains several seeds. Fagara odorata is often found in understory layers of tropical forests, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
